relevant_findings: numerous sessile, dome-shaped, umbilicated, flesh-colored to dull red and mildly tender nodules on scalp, face, trunk and perineum, gluteal areas, varying in size from 5 mm to more than 2 cm
craniofacial features included a broad nasal bridge, bulky nasal tip and rough facial skin
10 deciduous teeth, gingival hypertrophy, irregular and carious teeth
marked growth retardation (height 120 cm, weight 22 kg)
no evidence of scoliosis or hyperextensibility of joints
total serum IgE level was 5000 IU/ml (normal value 0–100 IU/ml); Phadiatop and fx5E were negative
white blood cell count of 10.34/ml with 73% granulocytes, 5.4% eosinophils
low immunoglobulin M level at 0.535 g/l (normal 0.63–2.77 g/l)
low CD3 at 55.1%, low CD8 at 19.3% (normal 20–35 g/l); CD4 and CD4/CD8 within normal range
pathologic periodontal changes presented as inflammatory granuloma
BMD 756 mg/cm3; T-3.0, Z-1.3 indicating osteoporosis

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: unresponsive with severe respiratory distress and cyanosis upon arrival at the emergency department; required cardiopulmonary resuscitation and mechanical ventilation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient was extubated within 24 hours, indicating improvement in condition.
